source_description: A popular question bank for medical students.

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient presents with chest pain. An ECG is shown below. %%EXHIBIT_1%% What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the mechanism of action for the drug described in the attached page? %%PAGE_1%%

media.content:
Aspirin

Aspirin works by inhibiting cyclooxygenase (COX) enzymes, which leads to reduced production of prostaglandins. This accounts for its anti-inflammatory, analgesic, and antipyretic effects.
